author: Michael Paradis
comment: Edit: Working as designed now. Uninstalled from phone and watch. Reinstalled. Working. Simple design that works well so far. Would love to see a timer / interval timer added to the app as well.   Seems to work on the phone. Can't get past the first screen on the watch though. Also, every time I open the app I get the tutorial pages again.  Tutorial is on the phone. And its a Ticwatch S with Android Wear 2.8. Would love to be able to use this.

reply.author: Electric Wave
reply.content:
Hi Michael,
Glad to hear it's working again! I already looked into what might have caused this issue, but haven't found anything yet. As for the timer option, I've been wanting to add that for a while, but I haven't gotten around to actually implementing it yet.

author: Lavy Jose Varghese
comment: Great app.  'X' symbols halfway outside the screen in light theme. Buttons in cards theme are better on the lower side. Please give option for  changing font color  and it would be nice if the delete symbol is scaled down a bit. 😊

reply.author: Electric Wave
reply.content: Hi, thanks for your feedback! Each device renders buttons at a slightly different size, so I'm going to try to make it more consistent. Putting the buttons at the bottom in the cards theme is a good idea, I'll see if I make this an option in the settings or change the theme itself. More customization is something I might add in a future release.

author: John Sutton
comment: I couldn't believe how poor the stopwatch selection was for Android Wear coming form a Pebble. Something basic like laps missing was a deal breaker and if you left the app up you couldn't tell the time. This app fixes those basic problems. I still wish there was one stop watch and timer app with even more functions, but this is more than adequate and better than the stock option. Being able to change the lap from the card and not opening the app is very handy.

author: John Williams
comment: Thank you. This is by far the BEST stopwatch app for Android wear.

reply.author: Electric Wave
reply.content: All values above 596 hours would cause an integer overflow, this has now been fixed. The maximum value is now 292 million years, have fun on your time travel adventures ;)

author: Peter T.
comment: Awesome app for runners. Great for interval training. Simple to use and u can export the lap times. Thanks!

author: Martin Sanderson
comment: The default Wear stopwatch has major issues when running - it doesn't stay on screen, the card for it doesn't remain at the top of the pile, and there are no start/stop controls from the card. Basically it's useless for timing things with any degree of accuracy. This app fixes all that, looks better and backs up the results. Should be the standard for all Wear devices!
title: Best stopwatch for Android Wear

author: Imran Khan
comment: Love the sync to phone option where I can see all my laps. Thank you
title: Use it daily

author: Kenny Bonner
comment: I would argue that this is the best stopwatch on Android wear.  It's not perfect, but as a free app, I can't complain.  It takes a few tries to sync to my phone, but that's really my only major complaint.  And Electric Wave is pretty good about updating.  It might not do things like best lap or average lap times, but at least you can delete laps and most importantly, export to XLS format.  And did I mention it's probably the best stopwatch on Android wear?

reply.author: Electric Wave
reply.content: There's an update rolling out now, which adds the last lap to the first page.

reply.author: Electric Wave
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback. I'm not sure what's causing this problem. Could you send me an error report?
